intro: Everettiodendron philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine everettiodendron, is a rare and endemic tree species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elongated, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
